oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gereon Kaiping
Owen Edwards
Marian Klamer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
This is the second version of LexiRumah, with the following major changes:
Form IDs have been reset Forms are now given (a) as found in the source, (b) in standardized IPA, (c) in BIPA segments and (d) in an orthography more accessible to local speakers The base URL has been moved to its own third-level domain, lexirumah.model-ling.eu Bad automatic cognate codes have been removed New languages have been added
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lexical database
Timor-Alor-Pantar languages
Austronesian languages
CLDF
CLLD
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: lessersunda/lexirumah-data: Orthographic Variety

Owen Edwards
Marian Klamer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Version 2.2.2 of the LexiRumah database of languages of Eastern Indonesia.
In this release, we mostly expand the bulk a bit eastwards to include more languages of Maluku

Funding: Reconstructing the past through languages of the present: the Lesser Sunda Islands Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (The Hague) GRANT NUMBER: 277-70-012 URL: https://www.nwo.nl/en/research-and-results/research-projects/i/91/22391.html

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LexiRumah 2.2.2

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gereon Kaiping
Marian Klamer
Jiang Wu
Thijs Bleyenberg
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
LexiRumah (from Lexicon and Ind. Rumah = house) is an online database containing lexical data about languages of the Lesser Sunda islands. The database contains transcribed wordlist data and was set up and is maintained by the NWO Vici project “Reconstructing the past through languages of the present: the Lesser Sunda Islands” at Leiden University.
An online version is available from http://www.model-ling.eu/lexirumah/.
Supported by the NWO Vici grant "Reconstructing the past through languages of the present: the Lesser Sunda Islands", Leiden University 2014–2019
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: linguistics
lexicon
indonesia
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LexiRumah: Lexical data of Lesser Sunda lects

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gereon Kaiping
Owen Edwards
Marian Klamer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
A lexical database of languages of the Lesser Sunda Islands and their suggested relations. Available through an online-interface on https://lexirumah.model-ling.eu
Changes to this version:
Fixing to several minor issues Adding languages further to the east Resetting IPA segmentation Small improvements to the online UI (see the UI repository)

Funding: Reconstructing the past through languages of the present: the Lesser Sunda Islands Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (The Hague) GRANT_NUMBER: 277-70-012 URL: https://www.nwo.nl/en/research-and-results/research-projects/i/91/22391.html

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Aguilar Panchi, Evelyn Michelle
Lee, Saetbyul
Brodetsky, Evgenia
Urban, Matthias
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
This repository contains source data for CINWA - Database of Cultivated plants and their names in the indigenous languages of South America
If you use these data please cite the database
Aguilar Panchi, Evelyn Michelle, Saetbyul Lee, Evgenia Brodetsky, and Matthias Urban (eds.). 2022. CINWA - Database of Cultivated plants and their names in the indigenous languages of South America. Version 0.9. Available online at cinwa.org.
If you would like to cite specific data entries, please also acknowledge the original source by consulting the reference that is associated with that entry. For example: Cook, Dorothy M., and Frances L. Gralow. 2001. Diccionario bilingüe koreguaje-español español-koreguaje. Santafé de Bogotá: Editorial Alberto Lleras Camargo. In: Aguilar Panchi, Evelyn Michelle, Saetbyul Lee, Evgenia Brodetsky, and Matthias Urban (eds.). 2022. CINWA - Database of Cultivated plants and their names in the indigenous languages of South America. Version 0.9. Available online at cinwa.org.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CINWA: Database of Cultivated plants and their names in the indigenous languages of South America

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Noëlle Sommer
Natalia Levshina
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This database contains information about differential and optional marking of A and P, including individual case markers and diverse conditions for their usage. It also shows whether a particular language fits or violates different referential scales, as far as the use of markers is concerned. Both global and local marking patterns are included.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cldf:StructureDataset
linguistics
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cross-linguistic differential and optional marking database

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cldf:StructureDataset
linguistics
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CLDF dataset derived from Tang and Her's "Quantitative typological data on classifiers and plural markers" from 2019
